alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 10:04PM EDT until September 13 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Montgomery County in central Maryland... * Until 115 AM EDT. * At 1004 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Germantown... Gaithersburg... Leesburg... Olney... Damascus... Lansdowne... Lowes Island... Poolesville... Montgomery Village... North Potomac... Redland... Great Falls... Countryside... Boyds... Clarksburg... Darnestown... Washington Grove... Laytonsville... Barnesville... Dawsonville... This includes the following Flood Prone Roads... Route 97 at The Patuxent River, Hipsley Mill Road at The Patuxent River, Zion Road at Hawlings River, Log House Road at Magruder Branch, Elton Farm Road and Howard Chapel Road and Woodfield Road at Churchill Downs Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
